events.label: Innovative computer science student at Trinity College, University of Cambridge, with proven success in competitive programming and software development. Gold medalist in the International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI) and a proactive leader in the UK competitive programming community. Adept at solving complex problems, leading collaborative technical projects, and bridging the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world applications.

events.label: Experience
Trading Intern, Jane Street | London, UK | New York, USA
Problem Tester and Presenter, British Informatics Olympiad (BIO) | London, UK

Conceived and developed a visualization tool to aid participants in understanding and solving complex algorithmic challenges during the 2024 British Informatics Olympiad, improving problem-solving efficiency for participants.
Collaborated with the organizing committee to enhance the competition experience by introducing analysis tools for post-event review and discussion.
Published problem solutions and video tutorials, gaining over 1,000 views, establishing a strong online presence for UK coding communities.
Organizer and Team Leader, International Advanced Tournament in Informatics (IATI) | Shumen, Bulgaria
Led the organization of UK’s participation in this prestigious international competition, coordinating logistics, team selection, and travel arrangements for a team of 6 students.
Secured a medal as a participant while driving the team to success in a high-pressure, competitive environment.
Actively liaised with event organizers and international teams, fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Content Creator and Educator, YouTube Channel @erekleroinishvili2340 | Remote
Created over 30 video tutorials on competitive programming and algorithmic problem-solving, viewed by 180+ subscribers with 10,000 total views.
Built a resource hub for British Informatics Olympiad training, providing previously unavailable tutorials to challenges, filling a critical gap for aspiring competitive coders in the UK.
Actively engaged with the coding community through Q&A sessions, contributing to educational outreach and community growth.
Projects
Trader Lingo
Developed a web application to help future traders master basic trader jargon.
Uses "interleaved practice with variability"—a technique that helps effectively internalize key vocabulary
Stock Exchange Server Simulator
Developed a stock exchange server simulator after analyzing the technical description of Iceberg orders by the London Stock Exchange. Simulated Iceberg orders execution and visualization.
Released the project as open-source software on GitHub, contributing to the coding community and receiving positive feedback for the accuracy, extendibility and elegance of the solution.
More info

Iceberg orders are some of the most interesting addition to modern trading. After reading the relevant Technical Description by the London Stock Exchange, Erekle built a simple simulator that would have full functionality to read and execute Iceberg orders against the order book, generate trade messages and show the current order book in real time.

label.label: Technical Description by the London Stock Exchange

events.label: Annihilation Game - BIO Problem Visualisation Tool
Designed a visualization tool to simplify the understanding of a complex problem "The Thing" in the British Informatics Olympiad 2024, helping contestants efficiently search for the winning strategy.
Tool integrated features such as random board generator, board editor, move history, and an analysis tool for post-contest discussions.
More info

label.label: When volunteering as a Problem Tester at British Informatics Olympiad, Erekle realized that one of the problems, called

would present an unforeseen challenge to the contestants: the game described in the problem would be hard to visualize in limited time. Erekle decided to build a visualization tool - The Annihilation Game. The organizers approved it and the contestants received the visualization tool in addition to the problem statement. The tool featured functionality like board size selector, random board state generator, board editor, move history, and even an analysis tool. The analysis tool was enabled after the contest and was successfully used during problem discussion. It is available online for training and is linked from my video discussing the problem.
with problem description, main insights and the solution in C++
Source code - Solution to BIO Problem "The Thing"
